stanza.line: Thou blind fool Love what dost thou to mine eyeseyes
That they behold and see not what they seesee
They know what beauty is see where it lieslies
Yet what the best is take the worst to bebe
If eyes corrupt by over-partial lookslooks
Be anchored in the bay where all men rideride
Why of eyes falsehood hast thou forged hookshooks
Whereto the judgment of my heart is tiedtied
Why should my heart think that a several plotplot
Which my heart knows the wide world common placeplace
Or mine eyes seeing this say this is notnot
To put fair truth upon so foul a faceface
In things right true my heart and eyes have errederred
And to this false plague are they now transferredtransferred
